docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 30 (AP) -- The United States, represented by the sharpshooting Peoria Caterpillars, produced a high scoring and tight defensive display today to defeat Canada, 84-50, in the world basketball tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Oct. 30 (AP) -- The United States, represented by the sharpshooting Peoria Caterpillars, produced a high scoring and tight defensive display today to defeat Canada, 84-50, in the world basketball tournament.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE DEFEATS CANADA, 84 TO 50; Solomon Paces Attack With 19 Points as Peoria Wins 4th Final-Round Game

docs.snippet: British sterling and the Canadian dollar enjoyed a good week so far as turnover was concerned. However, it was not productive of any wide swing of rates and the net improvement noted was confined to minor fractions.
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling and the Canadian dollar enjoyed a good week so far as turnover was concerned. However, it was not productive of any wide swing of rates and the net improvement noted was confined to minor fractions.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week ended Oct. 29, 1954

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 1 -- Poland opposed today a move in the General Assembly's Special Political Committee for the prompt admission of Laos and Cambodia to the United Nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 1 -- Poland opposed today a move in the General Assembly's Special Political Committee for the prompt admission of Laos and Cambodia to the United Nations.
docs.abstract: Laos and Cambodia bids opposed by Poland, Assembly com; backed by 5 Western nations; Colombia, Cuba, Uruguay reprs hold Assembly alone has admission power; challenge Security Council role

headline.main: 2 INDOCHINA LANDS ATTACKED AT U.N.; Pole Opposes Entry of Laos and Cambodia Now -- Says They Haven't Fulfilled Pact

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 1 -- Prof. Walter Hallstein, West German Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, said today that "we certainly have to talk to Russia" about the recent Paris conference.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 3 (UP) -- China scored a major upset in the world amateur basketball championship tonight by defeating Canada, 74 -- 61, thus costing the Canadians their chance to finish third in the final round.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 3 (UP) -- China scored a major upset in the world amateur basketball championship tonight by defeating Canada, 74 -- 61, thus costing the Canadians their chance to finish third in the final round.

headline.main: CHINESE QUINTET WINS; Upsets Canada, 74 to 61, in World Amateur Tourney

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 4 (AP) -- The Peoria Caterpillars, representing the United States in the world basketball tournament, breezed to their sixth straight victory without defeat today with a 74-30 romp over Israel.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 4 (AP) -- The Peoria Caterpillars, representing the United States in the world basketball tournament, breezed to their sixth straight victory without defeat today with a 74-30 romp over Israel.

headline.main: U. S. FIVE, BRAZIL TO MEET FOR TITLE; Peoria Routs Israel, 74-30, and Host Team Defeats Uruguay in World Play

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 5 (AP) -- The Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars, representing the United States, tonight won the second world basketball tournament, defeating Brazil, 62 -- 41. Each team entered the game unbeaten in six games.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 5 (AP) -- The Peoria (Ill.) Caterpillars, representing the United States, tonight won the second world basketball tournament, defeating Brazil, 62 -- 41. Each team entered the game unbeaten in six games.
docs.abstract: Peoria (Ill) Caterpillars wins world champ, Rio de Janeiro

headline.main: U. S. FIVE DEFEATS BRAZIL FOR TITLE; Unbeaten Peoria Caterpillars Win, 62-41, in Capturing World Tourney Crown

docs.snippet: PARIS, Nov. 5 -- The appeals board of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization has ruled against a decision of Director General Luther Evans to discontinue the employment of four United States citizens.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 5 -- The appeals board of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization has ruled against a decision of Director General Luther Evans to discontinue the employment of four United States citizens.
docs.abstract: UNESCO appeals bd rules against Evans decision not to renew 4 contracts

headline.main: UNESCO UNIT BARS DISMISSAL OF FOUR; Appeals Board Upsets Chief's Move to Oust U. S. Citizens Under Security Cloud
